SENT.plain: We report a successful case of living-donor lobar lung transplantation (LDLLT) for severe bronchiolitis obliterans (BO) after bone marrow transplantation (BMT)
The patient is a 29-year-old woman who underwent BMT because of aplastic anemia in 1995
In 1996, BO developed in the patient because of chronic graft-versus-host disease
In May 2000, a LDLLT was performed
Pulmonary function tests showed improvement of both vital capacity and forced expiratory volume in 1 second
At present, 91 months after BMT and 38 months after lung transplantation, the patient is in good health
LDLLT may offer a therapeutic option for the treatment of BO after BMT
